qas.question: The Center for Public Integrity found that 151 of what primate were moved from the New England Primate Research Center into exotic pet trade?
What happened in 1976 that impacted this primate's classification as Endanger?

answers.text: over 800 cotton-top tamarins were imported into the United States

qas.question: What school is affiliated with the New England Primate Research Center?
What school was running the pet trade?
How many cotton-top tamarins were traded out of the US in 1976?
Who works for the New England Regional Primate Research Center?
What was the official number of the cotton-top tamarins species under the ESA?
How many primates did Harvard purchase?

context: <b5_0>Green<b5_0/> and the CPI further noted another exploit of the ESA in their discussion of the critically endangered <a0_0>cotton-top tamarin<a0_0/> (Saguinus oedipus). Not only had they found documentation that <b7_0>151<b7_0/> of these primates had inadvertently made their way from the <a2_0><b3_0>Harvard<b3_0/><a2_0/>-affiliated New England Regional Primate Research Center into the exotic pet trade through the aforementioned loophole, but in October 1976, <a1_0>over <b4_0><b6_0>800<b6_0/><b4_0/> cotton-top tamarins were imported into the United States<a1_0/> in order to beat the official listing of the species under the ESA.
